alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 02 at 10:19AM MST until February 02 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW, SLICK AND HAZARDOUS TRAVEL, AND MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES THROUGH THIS EVENING... .A slow moving storm system will keep light snow falling across the area this afternoon. The heaviest snow fell overnight along the I-25 Corridor from Fort Collins through the Denver metro area. Light snow will likely linger into early evening, but then come to an end or diminish to flurries in most areas by mid to late evening. Temperatures will be very cold with lows tonight dropping well below zero. For the latest road conditions, go to cotrip.org or dial 511. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Light snow, ending this evening. Additional snow accumulations 1 to 2 inches. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills, and The Southern Front Range Foothills. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
